workflowSteps.details: Received prior authorization form, medical records, polysomnography report, doctor notes, and insurance card
workflowSteps.comments: Document quality excellent - all forms properly filled and signed

workflowSteps.details: Extracted patient demographics, insurance information, and medical history
workflowSteps.outcome: Patient: Rebecca Hardin (48F), Member ID: U7131533302, Ambetter insurance
workflowSteps.comments: Insurance verification successful - active coverage confirmed

workflowSteps.details: Analyzed sleep study results, medical history, and current CPAP compliance
workflowSteps.outcome: AHI 8.9/hr, SpO2 nadir 69%, BMI 45.6, compliant with current therapy
workflowSteps.comments: Clear medical necessity for CPAP replacement - device 5+ years old

workflowSteps.details: Evaluated clinical justification for CPAP device replacement
workflowSteps.outcome: High medical necessity score (96%) - patient compliant, documented OSA, device replacement needed
workflowSteps.comments: Patient shows excellent compliance with current CPAP therapy

workflowSteps.details: Verified coverage criteria for DME CPAP replacement
workflowSteps.outcome: Meets all policy requirements - documented OSA, compliant patient, appropriate device age
workflowSteps.comments: All coverage criteria satisfied - no prior authorization required for replacement

workflowSteps.details: Calculated estimated costs for CPAP device and supplies
workflowSteps.comments: Cost within reasonable range for CPAP replacement with supplies

workflowSteps.details: AI analysis of clinical data and policy compliance
workflowSteps.outcome: Recommendation: APPROVE - Clear medical necessity with high confidence (95%)
workflowSteps.comments: Strong clinical justification with documented patient compliance

workflowSteps.details: Generated approval letter and authorization number
workflowSteps.comments: Authorization valid for 12 months from approval date

keyFindings.clinicalJustification: Patient has documented obstructive sleep apnea (AHI 8.9/hr) with oxygen desaturation (SpO2 nadir 69%). Current CPAP device is 5+ years old and requires replacement. Patient demonstrates excellent compliance with therapy (Epworth score 3/24) and shows clinical improvement.
keyFindings.medicalNecessity: High medical necessity (96%) - CPAP replacement is clinically indicated for continued treatment of OSA. Patient is compliant with current therapy and replacement device will maintain therapeutic benefit.
keyFindings.policyCompliance: Meets all coverage criteria for DME replacement. Patient has documented OSA diagnosis, is compliant with current therapy, and device age exceeds manufacturer recommendations for replacement.
keyFindings.costEfficiency: Cost-effective treatment option - CPAP therapy prevents more expensive complications of untreated OSA including cardiovascular events, diabetes complications, and motor vehicle accidents.

recommendations.immediate: Approve CPAP replacement with supplies - clear medical necessity
recommendations.followUp: Schedule 3-month follow-up to assess device compliance and effectiveness
recommendations.monitoring: Track patient compliance through device data downloads
recommendations.education: Provide patient education on CPAP maintenance and supply replacement schedule

systemNotes.automationTrigger: High confidence clinical data analysis triggered automated approval
systemNotes.humanReview: No human review required - all criteria met for automated approval
systemNotes.exceptionHandling: No exceptions identified - standard DME replacement case
systemNotes.auditTrail: Complete audit trail maintained for all decision points and data sources
